message: Read the Sana After Story?
Yes
No

name: Airi
message: “Ah!”
I wonder what she’s like.
I can’t help myself.
She’s right there.

name: Shingo
message: “...Sena?”

name: Airi
message: “That’s right. You’re Sakuno’s brother, correct?”
It’s the same voice I’ve been listening to on the phone.
Her face breaks into a smile.
And yet she maintains a stunning air of elegance.

name: Airi
message: “You were easy to spot. You look just like I pictured you.”
—As for me? She looks even better than anything I’d pictured.
I’m stuck, just looking up at her.
I don’t even remember to breathe.

name: Airi
message: “We made it, Sakuno. Our ordeal is over!”

name: Sakuno
message: “...Shingy.”

name: Shingo
message: “Ah... yeah.”
I feel my sister’s eyes on me.
I slowly draw in a breath—
And remember how I got here.
The sweet fragrance of olive trees fills the night.
I do love the fall.
I breathe more deeply for a moment, appreciating the aroma.

name: Shingo
message: “Okay. You left Mirror Mall and then got lost? Is that right, Sakuno?”
The tone of my question is gentle.

name: Sakuno
message: “Sure did. It’s been a while since I got lost... quite this badly.”

name: Sakuno
message: “I don’t have a clue where I am.”
The voice from the phone belongs to my kid sister and—for once—actually sounds apologetic.
When she didn’t return promptly from a trip to the shops, I had my suspicions. Yep, she got lost again.

name: Shingo
message: “Okay. Glad I gave you a call.”
She’s generally a calm, smart girl, but her DNA is missing the strand for a sense of direction.
She keeps the condition under control most of the time, but when it does flare up, she goes totally off the map.

name: Sakuno
message: “I’m sorry.”

name: Shingo
message: “No, it’s fine. I’m glad this is nothing worse. With your cute face, I was worried about all sorts of stuff.”
I often do this—use humor to hide my embarrassment.
I’m not good at people being apologetic around me. Even my sister—hell, especially my sister.

name: Sakuno
message: “Nothing to worry about. I’m just lost.”
My trick works, anyway, because she’s quickly back to her normal self.
—But we still need to resolve this issue.

name: Shingo
message: “That’s right. Nothing to worry about. I just have to find you.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Right. If I’m lost, you come find me.”

name: Shingo
message: “Just like always. You know the drill.”

name: Sakuno
message: “I’ll give you a call if I spot a landmark.”

name: Shingo
message: “Ahaha, roger that. Keep in touch.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Bye.”
I laugh as I end the call.
That really is just how we roll. Sakuno always trusts and relies on me.

name: Shingo
message: “I had a feeling she might have gotten herself lost. It’s a good thing I left the house already.”
As her brother, now I need to find my cute kid sister and prove that her trust in me is founded.

name: Shingo
message: “Okay! Hang in there, Sakuno!”
I set out.
The big shopping mall she went to today is on the other side of the station.
Those who live on this side, including us, rarely cross to the other.
Sakuno normally does her shopping at a supermarket that’s much closer to the house.
It makes me wonder why she would do this today. But I do have some idea.

name: Shingo
message: “...She’s getting ready for tomorrow.”
I look up at the sky again.
After all, tomorrow will bring us into the month of October.

name: Shingo
message: “Okay. Have you spotted any landmarks? Can you see anything in front of you?”

name: Sakuno
message: “A hill...”

name: Sakuno
message: “Haah, haah... phew...”

name: Shingo
message: “...Are you okay?”

name: Sakuno
message: “I don’t know...”

name: Sakuno
message: “I’m exhausted...”

name: Shingo
message: “...Hmmm.”
I’ve been walking for about another twenty minutes after crossing the tracks.
I get in touch with her again, to find Sakuno sounding completely exhausted on the other end of the line.
She’s a calm, smart girl—with a terrible sense of direction and limited stamina. That’s Sakuno.

name: Shingo
message: “I’m sorry. ‘Hill’ isn’t really descriptive enough to help me out here.”
I hate to say it, but there’s no way for me to find her based on such limited information.

name: Shingo
message: “If you could just look around yourself a little more—”
“Come on, Sakuno, get with it! Here, I’ll hold your hand!”
I press the phone closer to my ear.

name: Sakuno
message: “Okay... thanks, Airi...”
“No worries. You’re helping me out here too, Sakuno. Come on, explain what you can see to your brother.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Okay... Shingy, I can see tracks on the other side of the hill. And then...”

name: Shingo
message: “...Hold on.”

name: Shingo
message: “Sakuno, is there someone there with you?”
It sounds like someone—with a voice I don’t recognize—is helping Sakuno through this on the other end of the line.

name: Sakuno
message: “Ah, yeah... there’s someone. Haah, ooh...”

name: Sakuno
message: “I made friends with her after our first call. She’s pulling me along by the hand right now.”

name: Shingo
message: “Huh? Are you sure she’s—”

name: Sakuno
message: “Airi, take over.”
“Huh? On the phone?”

name: Sakuno
message: “It’s my brother.”
“Seriously? Okay, give it here.”

name: Shingo
message: “Hey, hello? Sakuno?”

name: Airi
message: “Hello? Sakuno just handed me her phone. I’m Airi Sena.”

name: Shingo
message: “Oh, um, hello. I’m Sakuno’s brother, Shingo Uryu.”
I panic a little. I also feel my back snap up straight.
That’s the kind of mysterious power that resonates from the voice on the other end of the line now that I hear it clearly for the first time.
She sounds—refined, if that isn’t too hackneyed a phrase.

name: Shingo
message: “I’m sorry for all the trouble my sister is causing you. You really seem to be helping her out.”

name: Airi
message: “Oh, not at all.”

name: Airi
message: “I’m in the same boat as her. I got lost too.”
I’m not sure how to respond to that.
She at least has the decency to sound embarrassed about it, clearly transmitted over the phone.

name: Airi
message: “Getting lost is why we found each other. No need to thank me. Sakuno is helping me as much as I’m helping her.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Airi...”

name: Airi
message: “Sakuno, please, don’t sound so pathetic. We’re in this together.”
She sounds a little bossy as well.
Definitely in control. Locked down and buttoned up.
And yet with just as bad a sense of direction as Sakuno! Really?

name: Airi
message: “You there?”

name: Shingo
message: “Yeah, I’m here.”
I wonder what she’s like.
I can’t help but have that thought.
And from that moment on—

name: Shingo
message: “Hello? Sena?”

name: Airi
message: “Yes.”
Sena becomes the one in charge of the phone.
It’s a strange feeling to be spending so long on the phone with my sister’s new friend.
There’s nothing really connecting us.
It feels like we’re close, but we’re not. Not really.
But I have to continue.

name: Shingo
message: “What can you see?”

name: Airi
message: “The road starts down in front of us. We can see the lights in the distance.”

name: Shingo
message: “Ah, okay. That sounds about right.”
I walk along as I listen to her description of their surroundings, trying to pin down their location.

name: Airi
message: “Where are you now?”

name: Shingo
message: “The park. By the steps.”

name: Airi
message: “Ah, I see. That’s a big help. We should be able to find you.”

name: Shingo
message: “Okay. Good, good.”
We’re definitely getting closer together.
I’m sure I’m close to finally being reunited with my sister.

name: Shingo
message: “...Is Sakuno okay?”

name: Airi
message: “You really act like a big brother.”
Sena gives a kind of giggle at my brotherly concern.

name: Shingo
message: “Yeah. Are you an only child?”

name: Airi
message: “That’s right. So it feels... nice, doing this.”

name: Airi
message: “I’m sorry if that’s presumptive of me.”

name: Shingo
message: “Not at all. I’m actually enjoying it too. How are we coming along?”

name: Airi
message: “Give me a moment—Sakuno?”

name: Sakuno
message: “Haah, haah, Airi, I’m done for.”

name: Airi
message: “You can see your brother any moment! Hang in there, Sakuno!”

name: Sakuno
message: “I can hang. Let’s hang together.”

name: Airi
message: “Good, good. If you can hang in there, so can I.”
It sounds like each of them is helping the other to carry on.
Or more like—Sena is continually providing reassurance to Sakuno.
As her brother, that makes me so happy. Sakuno has clearly made a nice new friend!

name: Shingo
message: “Good! Keep going! Almost there! The two of you—”

name: Airi
message: “Will just keep walking, yes.”

name: Shingo
message: “That’s right. You should be seeing the lights of the station now. Keeping going and you’ll reach the park.”

name: Shingo
message: “I don’t want to miss you both. These steps make a good landmark, so I’ll wait here.”

name: Airi
message: “Understood! I’ll be sure to get Sakuno to you, so just hang in there a little longer.”
—Really, what kind of person is she?
Her crisp, in-control voice makes me ask that question again.
The fact I still only know her as a voice makes me all the more interested.
In a short moment more, she should be arriving here with Sakuno.
I actually feel pretty excited by this prospect.
And then—
For a moment or two, I forget to breathe.
—The two parties finally become one.

name: Shingo
message: “Sena. Thank you so much.”

name: Airi
message: “No, thank you. We’re fine now, and that’s all thanks to you.”
I give her a bow of my head, but that’s her immediate reply.
It makes me happy.
She’s just as nice as I imagined her to be—but also a whole heck of a lot prettier.

name: Airi
message: “This is thanks to Sakuno, too. I’m happy fate put me in your path, Sakuno.”
Sena’s beautiful face smiles again as she takes Sakuno’s hands.

name: Sakuno
message: “Airi, can we meet again?”

name: Airi
message: “Of course! We’re already best friends.”

name: Sakuno
message: “That’s right.”
The two girls laugh and smile.
Their shared experience does seem to have already brought them close.

name: Shingo
message: “If you’re going to be spending a lot of time together, then at least the next time you get lost I can find you both at once.”

name: Airi
message: “I won’t be getting lost again. I’ll stick to the streets I know from now on.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Please come find us again, Shingy!”

name: Airi
message: “Hey, Sakuno! You’re clearly planning on getting lost again!”

name: Sakuno
message: “Today wore me out but it was lots of fun. Let’s have Shingy find us again.”

name: Airi
message: “Oh, you little scamp! How can I refuse?”

name: Airi
message: “Let’s at least try and beat our time from this little adventure, shall we?”

name: Sakuno
message: “I’ll work on it.”

name: Airi
message: “I think you might be the problem!”
But Sakuno is good at commandeering a conversation, and even the intelligent Sena already seems to be under her thumb.

name: Shingo
message: “Okay. It’s late. Let’s get home, for today.”
It’s getting pretty late now. I tilt my head a little.

name: Shingo
message: “Sena, we can walk you home first, if you like—”

name: Airi
message: “No need. I’m fine from here.”

name: Airi
message: “...I live really close.”

name: Shingo
message: “Oh, okay.”

name: Airi
message: “Really close. You take Sakuno and head home, like a good big brother.”

name: Airi
message: “She’s done all this shopping for you. Whatever she’s making, I’m sure it will be delicious.”

name: Shingo
message: “...Thanks for everything. Really.”
I give another bow, this time low and deep.
I try to be considerate of others, which is why Sena’s own consideration moves me so much.

name: Sakuno
message: “Bye-bye, Airi.”

name: Airi
message: “See you soon, Sakuno.”

name: Shingo
message: “Goodnight.”

name: Airi
message: “Yes, goodnight!”
Sena laughs, gives a nod, and then turns away. Her long hair flows like the Milky Way.
Her back is straight as a rod, and she walks like a princess.
The refreshing coolness of her presence lingers as she disappears up the stairs.

name: Shingo
message: “...Okay. Let’s head home too, Sakuno.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Okay.”
Sakuno lifts up the shopping bags that Airi just returned to her. She’s completely back to her normal self.

name: Shingo
message: “You aren’t too worn out? I can carry you on my back if you like.”

name: Sakuno
message: “I’m the wrong age for that now.”

name: Shingo
message: “Does that mean you’re too old, or not decrepit enough? It could be either.”

name: Sakuno
message: “It doesn’t matter. I’m still walking home.”

name: Shingo
message: “Okay, okay.”
I set out. Sakuno trots right after me.

name: Sakuno
message: “Mirror Mall had all sorts of great stuff. You pay a lot for it, of course.”

name: Shingo
message: “You seem to have paid a lot. Are you planning a special meal tonight?”

name: Sakuno
message: “Maybe. Compared to normal.”

name: Sakuno
message: “But most of this is for your lunchbox tomorrow.”
I smile, understanding the reason Sakuno came all the way to Mirror Mall.

name: Shingo
message: “I had a feeling this was about tomorrow.”

name: Sakuno
message: “That’s right. I want to make a very special lunchbox for you. I can’t let you take anything substandard.”

name: Shingo
message: “Hahaha, thanks, Sakuno. It’s appreciated.”
I look up at the sky again.

name: Sakuno
message: “...October starts tomorrow.”

name: Shingo
message: “That’s right. Starting tomorrow—”
